page.title: 16A GAMEKEEPER ON BREDON HILL
page.content: A gamekeeper is a person who keeps vermin under control.{He shoots crows, {rabbits,magpies,rats,foxes, pigeons, {deer,mink, stoats, squirrels,ducks, {and weasels.}He shoots most of them because they are pests.He uses a 12 bore for everything except deer.He shoots deer with a 2.70 rifle.He shoots nearly all these pests but gassing and snaring are used occasion- ally. He breeds pheasants and partri- dge to shoot in the shooting season. He has to debeak the small pheasants to stop them pecking each other.He has 12 beaters on a shoot and 8 to 10 guns and he pays them 10 pounds.He uses dogs for picking up pheasants etc.He feeds the pheasants on wheat and pellets.He has had mink on the estate for four years.There are Fallow deer and Muntjak deer but no Roe deer on Overbury Estate.
